definitions.definition: That which resembles another thing; a likeness; a portrait; a counterpart.
To falsely produce what appears to be official or valid; to produce a forged copy of.
definitions.example: to counterfeit the signature of another, coins, notes, etc.

definitions.definition: To produce a faithful copy of.

definitions.example: to counterfeit the voice of another person

definitions.definition: (usually "be counterfeited") Of a turn or river card, to invalidate a player's hand by making a better hand on the board.
False, especially of money; intended to deceive or carry appearance of being genuine.
definitions.example: This counterfeit watch looks like the real thing, but it broke a week after I bought it.

definitions.definition: Assuming the appearance of something; deceitful; hypocritical.
